title: Collection of Very Rare Stuff
review: The Taj museum is a small collection of interesting documents and items, mostly related to the Taj. Should probably be made more informative. Also, the panels have become old, and should probably be upgraded. It is a part of a duo of buildings that are collectively called the Jal Mahal. It is sometimes mistakenly referred to as the Naubatkhana.

title: Good Museum
review: This is one of the very good place to see at Taj Mahal. you can lot of things of olden days here and understand the culture.

title: Great museum
review: This is easy to miss, particularly if you have a tour guide who's more interested in getting you back to the shops so they can get their commission. Fascinating museum and well worth seeing.

title: Original Mughal 7th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal
review: 7th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. excellent Taj Museum, housing a number of original Mughal miniature paintings. Taj and some nifty celadon plates, said to split into pieces or change colour if the food served on them contains poison.

title: Fascinating
review: Don't miss this when you visit the Taj Mahal! Makes the history so much more real. The 17th-century miniature paintings and calligraphy just slay me.

title: Most people don't go, but its worth it
review: The Taj Museum is slightly tucked away and the large majority of visitors to the site won't go in.  Which is a shame as it's got some interesting drawings of the complex.  Worth 10 minutes of your time.

title: Poor
review: This could be so much better, but again, badly maintained and it doesnt give you much to picture the process of the building

title: Must visit if you are in Tajmahal
review: Hey traveller's  this review is for special because 60percent people's those come agra for view Taj Mahal they don't know about this place " Taj Museum" guys this place is in Taj Mahal if you are in Taj Mahal ssoo this place also in Taj Mahal soo guys both are in one place soo must visit and know about the history of the Taj Mahal....

title: Short Visit Only
review: We spent about 20 minutes here only, as it is poorly maintained but worth a quick look for the history of the Taj.  Some good drawings too of the Taj but when you think of the money coming into the Taj Mahal complex and its UNESCO heritage it is very poor. Miss if you are short on time.

title: Average place
review: This Museum is located within Taj Mahal boundaries and there is nothing much to see except for all items, which will hardly take 15-20 min to complete this visit.

title: big museum besides the Taj Mahal
review: The Taj Museum houses royal ornaments, amazing paintings, portraits of Mughal emperors etc.It remains closed on Fridays.It has two floors and three galleries. The Museum displays all those things in connection to the creation of Taj Mahal. There are a total of one hundred and twenty one antiques showcased in the museum. These things can be broadly classified into Mugal manuscripts, Mugal miniature paintings, inscription samples, royal decrees, drawings and plans of Taj Mahal. Some more items are also exhibited in the museum like arms, utensils, specimen of decorative pieces, marble pillars, etc.The main hall showcases the most significant items.One can take a look at the portraits of Shah Jahan and Mumtaz Mahal. These are seen in an ornate wooden frame. Imitations of coins, which were minted in Agra, are also on displayed.

title: Small, nice museum
review: Inside the Taj Mahal. Closed on Fridays. Very small museum, will take you hardly 10 minutes to go in and come out. Has nice, old items dating to the Mughal period. Original coins, blueprints of the Taj, other artifacts used by the Mughal rulers.

title: She is a Wonder. Do not miss it!
review: If you are lucky and the day you visit this Wonder is not hazy, your pictures will be beautiful. If you can control the day, do it and try to pick up a clear day, Pics are so different! Buy a little piece of lapis lazury memory and keep it on your desk.

title: Small. Quaint Museum
review: The Taj Museum is quite nice and worth a visit. Make sure you ask your guide to take you here. It has a lot of nice items dating back to the time the monument was built.

title: Good visit
review: The Taj Museum is a double storeyed building, which lies within the Taj Mahal complex. Established in 1982, the museum comprises three galleries and a main hall. There is a gallery, where displays relating to the construction of the Taj Mahal and to the period of its construction are exhibited.

title: Good hotel
review: The Taj Mahal Museum is a museum within the complex of Taj Mahal. The museum was formed in 1982. Its a part Taj Mahal - one of the seven wonders of the world. Small museum, it will take hardly 10-15mins. Taj Museum is closed on Friday. It is divided into three galleries.

title: Located within the Taj Mahal grounds
review: I was not overly impressed with this museum, but it was a nice free attraction on the Taj Mahal grounds.b

title: Missed Opportunity
review: Ohh. I visited Taj Agra, but just missed to see this. But us heard it seems that it would have been a good visit. Next time sure.

title: Small museum inside Taj complex
review: During my holidays in Agra, I had visited the stunningly beautiful Taj Mahal complex and this museum is located inside the Taj complex. The museum has a draft design of the Taj Mahal complex and showcases the different semi precious stones with details of their origin which were used in creating the Taj. Photography is not allowed inside the museum. No separate ticket is required to visit this place.

title: located within taj mahal
review: this is a small museum located inside the taj mahal complex. while entering it will be on the left-hand side. has a nice water in front of it. and green grass square on its side. easy to find. u can see it if u find it open and have time. many miss it as they get too amused with overrated taj. the view of taz from its square is also unique. there is a sitting place where from u can enjoy taj view beating the crowd gathered at its front.

title: OLD SCHOOL MUSEUM
review: The display and dispositions of the art pieces it's really old style, but anyways once you enter in Taj mahal it worth it to take a look could be few minutes only.

title: Worth a dekho
review: The day we went to Taj, it was quite foggy so we decided to go to museum to pass time while we waited for fog to clear.

title: Don´t underestimate this museum
review: In this museum we can see many many swords from the era of Shaz Jahan. There are also original drawings and paintings of the emperor, the empress Muntaz Mahal and the princes. The most interesting are the drafts of Taj Mahal before they started to build it. No pictures allowed inside.

title: Nice visit
review: Good to see the historic Mughal items on display. One must visit the same. It is inside the taj complex. Must visit for history lovers.

title: Great Museum
review: The Taj is not just the tomb. The gardens are spectacular and the Museum is a plus. There are interesting objects (ancient guns and coins). I especially enjoy the drowning miniatures. An exceptional collection.

title: Taj museum
review: It's an part of Taj Mahal which has collection of different coins and tools used during Mughal reign.

title: Good for one time go
review: We were here during our Agra tour. It was a quick and nice stopover. Good view of the city from the top.

title: Improves your knowledge about the Taj history.
review: One should visit the museum on his trip to the Taj, else you will miss lot of things. Lot of things are kept safe of the mougal times.

title: Amazing  spiritual experience. The story behind the TajMajal overpowers you as you visit the site
review: The aura of love and mysticism envelopes you the moment you reach Taj Majal. This temple to everlasting love really touches your innermost feelings.

title: Okay museum
review: Located inside Taj Mahal complex. Since you are already there it is worth the stop inside. It will give you a better understanding of the Taj history and construction. The real reason to be here is the Taj itself, take a quick visit and spend most of your time just staring at the Taj itself.

title: Taj Museum
review: This was like most of the sites in India.....average if you have traveled elsewhere.  Worth seeing, but only if convenient.

title: Can be a great Museum but poorly kept.
review: Museum at Taj sounds awesome however its not great, it can be improved and be made a worth to visit but perhaps no body cares about that, still it has some good collection if not great.

title: Interesting
review: There are some interesting exhibits and artefacts on display within this small museum. We came across it by chance whilst visiting the Taj.

title: Need improvement
review: Taj Mahal is a great wonder of India. However, the museum that is in the taj mahal complex is poorly kept. There are some collections but I think it would be better if they put more information.

title: Museum
review: A museum which exibits the realms of the erst while mughal dynasty . Dont miss it if you have time its worth it

title: The Taj Museum
review: It is located western side of the gardens at Naubat Khana Inside the Taj complex. The small but great collection of artefacts like number of original Mughal miniature paintings, including a pair of 17th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal, gold and silver coins and arms like swords, dagger and etc. Also displaying architectural drawing of Taj Mahal and etc. It is a place of tourist interest inside Taj complex.

title: Excellent Museum!!!
review: Taj Museum is situated near Taj Mahal Agra. The Museum is not well maintained. Biut its historic place. Worthy visit.

title: Nice Collection
review: God place to witness everything related to the Mughal Era. The ammunitions and the crockeries were too good.

title: Taj Museum
review: Taj Museum is historical. There is a large collection of Mughal items in the museum. Must visit place. Especially for history lovers.

title: Museum inside Taj complex
review: Taj Museum is located inside Taj complex. Taj complex gives  insights into the mughal era. This museum has the many collection of swords and other war heads of those times. Museum preserves history about taj and mughal culture artifact.

title: Tells the story of the building of the Taj Mahal
review: Very interesting. It gives pictures and sketches of the building of the  great Mausoleum. However, there are no pictures allowed. It is free and on the grounds of the Taj Mahal.

title: Could be made more interesting
review: The so called museum was quite shabbily kept. The display, cleanliness , and lighting needs improving.

title: Small and not related to the Taj Mahal
review: There really isn't much to see here, it's included in your ticket to the Taj Mahal and in the grounds.

title: Not impressive!
review: You can entry here with the Taj ticket situated on ground of Taj. Not so impressive and poor light made me disappointing. You cannot take picture and i have not found too many relevance with Tajmahal.

title: A Small Complex within the Taj Premise
review: This is quite a small museum, detailing the history of Taj and its related events. Quite worth the time and no crowd at all.

title: not highly impressed
review: i thought the taj museum will be like a nice museum where i can take photographs and i can see more of the history of the taj.  this is very small and just like a tiny hut. they do have a little details about how it was built and started, but ok, not great and not directed related to taj

title: Taj museum
review: Taj museum is like small museum which preserving history about taj and mughal culture artifact..you can visit during taj tour..nice place to know history regarding taj

title: Face the Tajmahal and on left side is the Taj Museum.
review: This museum has the collection of swords and other war heads of those times. It can be given a visit post visiting Taj Mahal. It won't take much of your time.

title: Very nice painting museum
review: This museum is situated inside the taj complex. Various collection which includes Mughal paintings, gold and silver coins, architectural drawings of the Taj etc.

title: A museum
review: Located inside Taj complex giving insights into the mughal era. Coins paintings and other memorabilia.

title: Not really worth visiting
review: Although it is included in the price of your ticket to the Taj there is really very little to see and the lighting is very poor.   Unless you are trying to waste time it is not worth visiting.

title: Educational Opportunities
review: Learn about how the Taj came to be. How it was built, the important people and workers. The guesthouse across the courtyard and the scrapped proposal for building a Black Taj across the river. Excellent historical break from wandering around the Mausoleum.

title: Perfect for history buffs.
review: As it is inside the Taj Mahal complex it is worth visiting to see the artifacts that have survived from the Royal families of Agra.

title: Glad of the Visit
review: Almost 90% of the people come to the Taj Mahal and do not visit this museum on the grounds and included in the entrance. While I do not think it adds much to the building itself, the art and maps are a great way to get a good overview of the history of Agra and the Taj itself.

title: About the construction and history of the Taj Mahal.
review: Located inside the Taj Mahal complex, this museum is free and opens at 9:00 am. It shows building materials and their origin, land deeds, paintings, historical artefacts and so on. Worth a visit while you're there!

title: Small Musuem
review: A small musuem which is free of cost inside Taj Mahal complex. It consists of artificats during the times of Mughal . It is not very well maintained, but can be visited once by the history lovers as it takes such 15-20 minutes of one's time

title: Can Avoid
review: The Museum is located towards the western side and opens at 9:00 a.m., however considering the display at offer, its just a waste of time. Anyone who is very curious to know about the history of the monument can visit the same.

title: Wonderful
review: A must see in Agra along with all that one can put in holiday there.  I had a wonder time and would advise anyone to visit Agra and the Taj Mahal and all of the other attraction that the city has to offer

title: Small but informative museum !!!
review: Taj Museum is located in the Taj Mahal comples and is free to visit. It opens at 9:00 AM. It displays the construction materials, land materials and artificats of Mughal time. It gives you an idea about the history of the monument. We found it useful as we had our son curious to learn those facts.

title: Hidden Gem
review: The museum is situated to the left of the Taj Mahal and entry is free with your ticket - but so many people miss it! It is very small and I'd have liked more info on the construction of the Taj Mahal - however the beautiful Moghul illustrations make up for this - make sure you visit!

title: Taj Museum
review: Taj Museum is a small museum located within the Taj Mahal Complex. The ticket price includes admission price for the museum. The museum hardly has any visitors as most of the visitors are focused on seeing the Taj itself. However a visit to the museum gives one a good insight into various interesting aspects of the Taj as to its architectural planning and a little bit of information about the chief architect and the number of workers and the time it took to build the Taj.

title: A good way to conclude your Taj Mahal visit
review: It is a small museum located to the west, inside the Taj Mahal complex. The entry fee is included in the main ticket price. It explains where the marble and gems used in Taj Mahal were sourced from, and offers insights about Shah Jahan, and the mughals in a simple way. It requires a small amount of time, but also tells the story of the site briefly.

title: Mughal art
review: Taj Museum, Taj Mahal. (District Agra, Uttar Pradesh) The museum was established in 1982 in the ground floor in western Naubat Khana, also known as Jal Mahal, with in the Taj Mahal complex. It is a double storied building having a quadrangle projection outside and is built on a raised platform.

title: Very little to see
review: Next to the Taj Mahal, within the same complex, is a building originally used as a Jal Mahal or Naubat Khana. This building now holds a small museum.

title: Gives a completeness of Taj tour.
review: Located inside Taj Mahal complex, west-end. This is a must see for Taj Mahal visitors. Doesn't take more than 30 mins, but the arte-facts (farmans, coins, paintings etc) is worth seeing to imagine what life would have been during 1600s. Get that sense of completeness by visiting this place before you leave Taj Mahal Complex.

title: What's a boring experience
review: How is that possible that having such a wonder like Taj Mahal this kind of misery is offered to tourists?

title: Well worth a stop
review: This structure was a functional part of the Taj and is now a museum with a lot of compelling artifacts and explanations of the planning and building of the Taj.

title: Small and interesting
review: It is suitable to visit after visiting the mausoleum and the mosques, exposes material about the dynasties and the construction of the mausoleum, besides arms and other everyday objects.

title: Great
review: The Taj museum is a great place of moghal era collections. we saw the used belongings of emperors and there family members.

title: good collection from ASI
review: ASI has made very good effort in maintaining the museum.  Good collection but not sure what happened to so many of Sha-jahan's possession.

title: Inside Taj Mahal complex
review: The museum comprises of three galleries in addition to the main hall and has on display various exhibits relating mostly to the construction of the Taj Mahal and to the period of its builders. Totally 121 antiquities are on display, which are broadly categorized as Mughal miniature paintings, manuscripts, government decrees, specimen of calligraphy, arms, utensils, plans and drawings of Taj Complex, paintings, specimen inlay work, marble pillars, etc.

title: Nice place to boost your history knowledge..
review: Good collection of antiques, maps, and the history of the place. You get to know a lot about Taj through this museum. Do visit if visiting Taj Mahal

title: An insight into the history of Taj Mahal
review: Taj Mahal museum is located inside Taj Mahal complex. It is located near the main gate of the Taj Mahal.  It's a double storeyed building comprising of three galleries and a main hall.  This place had a good collection of antiques. Mughal Miniatures, Paintings, Government decrees, Utensils and Weapons are on display.  Taj Museum displays the original pieces of drawings of this grand monument.

title: Taj Museum - the place to feel Mughal era
review: We have already read about mughal era traditions, wars, weapons etc in our history books. During our study, we used to imagine about mughal era. When you visit Taj Museum, your imagination will be turned into visualization. After seeing mughal era things, you will feel that at present you are a part of Mughal era.

title: Taj Museum Great place for History Lovers
review: Inside the Ta Mahal is Taj Museum. It preservers actual map of Taj Mahal and original Mughal documents used to pass orders. It also has a collection of all precious stones and their origin used in Taj Mahal.It's very small and takes only 15-20min to see.

title: Some lovely pieces but not enough information.
review: This could be a wonderful museum but it's not as like most museums and monuments I've been to in India, there is very little background, context or interesting detail provided. About anything.  If you don't know in advance, who these Kings were, what sort of kings they were, how women were treated - apparently one Moghul had a 500 strong harem, but there's no information about that, or how th women were select d, what their lives were like or any of the detail about life at that time. As there's no furniture in any of these places, nothing to show what people s lives were like, even how long it took to build the fort, this palace or anything, it's a huge wastd opportunity. And the Taj museum has a few bits on view but that's it. Very disappointing.

title: Fantastic views, can enjoy with family!
review: Its very beautiful everyone should visit it once in their lifetime. It is a real beauty and views are fantastic, old is gold. I would love to come here again if I get a chance with my whole family so that they can also enjoy this beautiful place, trust me its awesome.

title: Must Visit
review: Taj Museum established in 1982 in the western Naubat Khana, also known as Jal Mahal. The Museum is in the Taj Mahal complex. In museum three gallery are their.

title: Not a highlight.
review: Is fine to waste some time as it cost no extra after foreigner ticket.

title: Small and simple
review: It is a small museum located within the Taj Mahal complex. Only those interested in history and archaeology may find this museum interesting otherwise it can be avoided. However, there is no entry fee for visiting this Museum and quick visit can always be made. There are very few items on display.  Photography is not allowed inside the museum.

title: Meseum
review: This museum is inside the taj complex. it is good for history lovers . one can enjoy the garden view from the museum.

title: History and samples of inlaid marble; but no photos allowed
review: The onsite museum has writeups of the construction.  It also has several samples of white marble inlaid with different colored stones.  But, one is not allowed to take photos in the museum.

title: History of TAJ
review: Good museum once you visit taj mahl must visit this place to understand the history behind it. Good one

title: “Know About Taj”
review: It is good for history lovers. you visit Taj Mahal,  must visit this place to understand the history behind it. The museum gives a good glimpse of Indian Mughal history.

title: Worth looing
review: I spent a short visit in the museum.  It is not extensive but worth a look, and also provides shade and some fans!

title: Very Romatic
review: Bring a date or love one here. Unfortunately I was traveling alone. Traveled there in the morning from Delhi. I recommend staying here for a night and maybe seeing this place at sunset. Also go over across the river on the backside of this place. The view looking back at the Taj Mahal is breathtaking.

title: awesome
review: This was truly a spectacular experience and especially since its one of the wonders of the world. But once you go there you can understand the romance , the peace and the tranquillity that experiences

title: A nice addition in the grounds of the Taj Mahal
review: The Taj Museum lies on the West side of the grounds of the Taj Mahal and makes a good addition to follow up a visit if you head to the main attraction early in the morning because it opens 3 hours later.

title: Museum to gain some insight regarding Taj Mahal
review: The Taj Mahal museum is located inside Taj Mahal complex. around 121 antiques are on display mostly Mughal miniatures, paintings, manuscripts, arms, etc.

title: Place to learn History
review: While we go though rumors about Taj and the Mughal rule and architecture, this place hosts lots of historic information and evidences to clarify the same. Warning: don't have high expectations - this place do not have all answers and requires many a maintenance activity

title: Paintings
review: This museum is inside Taj Mahal complex and consists mostly of paintings of Shahjahan era. Some weapons are also available.

title: Fascinating
review: Don't miss this when you visit the Taj Mahal! Makes the history so much more real. The 17th century miniature paintings and calligraphy just slay me.

title: Must See When In Taj
review: When in Taj do not miss to visit the Taj Museum and will not take much of your time as it is very small. The entry is free. They have kept different kinds of swords, marbles and they also have utensils made from special material which changes its color when coming in contact with poisonous food.

title: Neglected section of Taj Mahal
review: I was surprised to find this place as the neglected one, with a fact that it is a part of the history of India

title: TAJ IS GREAT!
review: This is great for the family to visit and children will love it. If your into your history this is the place to learn some interesting facts.

title: Less visited but worth
review: Its a less visited part of taj mahal but really worth for some time. You can see paintings, sculptures and some weapons of mughal dynasty.

title: Very Informative!
review: Taj Museum comprises of 3 galleries in addition to the main hall. It has on display various exhibits relating mostly to the construction of the Taj Mahal and to the period of its builders. There are 121 antiquities are on display which are broadly categorized as Mughal miniature paintings, manuscripts, government decrees, specimen of calligraphy, arms, utensils, plans and drawings of Taj Complex, paintings, specimen inlay work and marble pillars.

title: Place to Visit if extra time
review: If you have extra time, then it is place to visit so that  you can date history. If running short of time then you can skip the place

title: Definitely worth visiting
review: Not many people seem to visit his museum which is situated on the far left as you enter the main site. Amongst other items on display, are  the original construction plans for the Taj Mahal. Unfortunately, but understandably, you are not allowed to take photos inside.

title: It was not as i expected
review: It was not as I expected for Taj Museum, They must have some good memories which is connected to Tajmahal but they have only few paintings and some more things and its not justice with the great monument.

title: Worth Visiting
review: Access-able approach with a ramp.Amazing how advanced were architects of that period.Drawings are so accurate and detailed.

title: Go for it!
review: I highly recommend it, but please go when the weather isn't so hot! It has a great ambience and fantastic architecture. Got some really good pictures of it!

title: Beauty beheld
review: Obtaining your first view of the Taj Mahal in the distance does not prepare you for the overwhelming sense of awe when observed from a closer distance . Take time to stand still and try to stand directly in the centre and look down over the reflection pool to get the full impact . Early morning is the best time as less people but I'm sure the setting sun over it would also be great . Wifi is available and free at the Taj Mahal although extremely slow . Shoe covers are needed and supplied to walk on the marble ,but go barefoot if not hot , the marble feels great and so smooth otherwise wear socks

title: I am Rating it as a Poor because its a very small Muesum with very little History about Taj.
review: I am Rating it as a Poor because its a very small Museum with very little History about Taj. Taj it self is rich with History & among wonders but General Public is not able to earn the value of its History it has been locked.

title: The love and affection Shahjahan
review: The love and affection Shahjahan had for his wife is described in the carvings, drawings, paintings. "The background sky in the sunrise is one of the best scenery that you cannot find anywhere in this world.

title: just average
review: You can cover this as a part of Taj Mahal tour. But don't expect much of it. There is not enough info available for Taj. Rather go there only, if you have so much spare time in hand.

title: Honeymoon
review: Great place ! Clean and safe ! People friendly ! Family oriented ! Highly spirited ! Great cultures like environment ! Easy access to public transport ! Great spirit ! Loved to go back again !

title: nothing there, avoid
review: Visit Taj Mahal, skip this place. This will disappoint you more when you visit this after seeing the taj. Not much info available in this museum. Its better to skip this place and save sometime.

title: Artifacts & Scriptres
review: Do not miss this place.It gives a detailed information on the life of the Mughal Emperor & about the Taj Mahal.

title: Amazing Place in the early morining hours
review: If you go early in the AM you will be able to take pictures without 100s of people there. It is well worth the time.

title: Must visit whenever you come to Taj
review: This is the first time we spotted Taj Museum and visited it. The museum gives a glimpse of the mughal history and contains various rare artefacts. The artefacts are well catalogued and we recommend that every visitor at Taj should visit this museum.

title: Mediocre
review: It is free to enter now, but there isn't much to see. Just a meagre collection of calligraphy and some sketches of the Taj.

title: So-So
review: A but iffy here. There are a couple of govt of India outlets at the entrance/exit of the Taj and if this is the museum attraction, then its not worth entering. Not very sure though

title: Do visit if you love Taj
review: This is the first time we visited Taj Museum (like others we too visit only Taj Mahal). The museum gives a good glimpse of Indian Mughal history. The artifacts present are very rare and are very well cataloged.

title: Interesting but not mind blowing
review: I suppose it is very difficult for anything to compete with the Taj itself and so it probably pales a little in comparison being right beside it as it is. Nevertheless, crowded, narrow corridors and an interesting but far from comprehensive collection of artefacts make this worth visiting while you're there but otherwise not particularly memorable. But then it's not the memory of this museum that you're going there for.

title: Taj Museum
review: It was a great experience, the ambience was historical and the architecture was phenomenal.  This was in the month of July of 2007, and was part of golden triangle package.  I would highly recommend, that you should make sure to visit these places when the weather is cooler. The westerners from Europe, North America and many other colder temperature countries around the world may not cope with steamy hot weather conditions.  The temperature may easily spike well over 40s celcius.

title: Taj
review: Taj Mahal is a place not Museum which considered one of the best place aroun the world even I see it just luxury cemetery

title: Get to know Taj more personally here!
review: Ever wish to know deeply the history about Taj, This is the place to spend your time in. Don't rely on Guides. They feed information only what they know. Learn 1st hand, from the best source. Situated on the left of Taj.

title: Taj Museum - It gives a glimpse of the Mughal history
review: "Abode in Heaven" was the feeling when I entered the great seventh wonders of the world - TAJ MAHAL. Glorious place its describe the Passion of india ... Must visit once in lifetime.  The love and affection Shahjahan had for his wife is described in the carvings, drawings, paintings. "The background sky in the sunrise is one of the best scenery that you cannot find anywhere in this world.

title: for heritage lovers..
review: lovely.. amazing.. wow..

title: Excellent Museum
review: The Taj Museum is a double storeyed building, which lies within the Taj Mahal complex. The museum includes 3 galleries and a main hall. There is a gallery, where displays relating to the construction of the Taj Mahal and to the period of its construction are exhibited. The 1st gallery of the museum holds exhibits of plans and drawings of the architecture of Taj Mahal. The 2nd gallery of the museum displays jade and porcelain objects like Quran stand carved of jade, spouted vase carve of Jade and mirror mounted on stone. The 3rd  gallery of the museum exhibits the important royal Farmans and Waslis of famous calligraphy of the period. In the main hall, tourists can see paintings of Shah Jahan and his favorite wife Mumtaz Mahal.

title: A different kind of beauty
review: People are so caught up in the beauty of the Taj Mahal that they give this place a miss. They don’t know w what they are missing out on. We visited it after a local suggested us else even we would have missed out on it. The place is amazing with its paintings and drawings. It speaks aloud about the Taj Mahal through the various artifacts it has. A must visit for all, especially for history buffs.

title: TAJ MAHAL: A tribute to everlasting love
review: Anyone who's ever been in love must visit the Taj Mahal in India. It is simply the most beautiful structure ever erected as testament to one man's devotion to his bride. Dazzling at the time of its construction, it still retains its magnetism with an aura that captivates the beholder.

title: Collection of Very Rare Stuff
review: The Taj museum is a small collection of interesting documents and items, mostly related to the Taj. Should probably be made more informative. Also, the panels have become old, and should probably be upgraded. It is a part of a duo of buildings that are collectively called the Jal Mahal. It is sometimes mistakenly referred to as the Naubatkhana.

title: Good Museum
review: This is one of the very good place to see at Taj Mahal. you can lot of things of olden days here and understand the culture.

title: Original Mughal 7th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal
review: 7th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. excellent Taj Museum, housing a number of original Mughal miniature paintings. Taj and some nifty celadon plates, said to split into pieces or change colour if the food served on them contains poison.

title: Fascinating
review: Don't miss this when you visit the Taj Mahal! Makes the history so much more real. The 17th-century miniature paintings and calligraphy just slay me.

title: Great museum
review: This is easy to miss, particularly if you have a tour guide who's more interested in getting you back to the shops so they can get their commission. Fascinating museum and well worth seeing.

title: Poor
review: This could be so much better, but again, badly maintained and it doesnt give you much to picture the process of the building

title: Most people don't go, but its worth it
review: The Taj Museum is slightly tucked away and the large majority of visitors to the site won't go in.  Which is a shame as it's got some interesting drawings of the complex.  Worth 10 minutes of your time.

title: Must visit if you are in Tajmahal
review: Hey traveller's  this review is for special because 60percent people's those come agra for view Taj Mahal they don't know about this place " Taj Museum" guys this place is in Taj Mahal if you are in Taj Mahal ssoo this place also in Taj Mahal soo guys both are in one place soo must visit and know about the history of the Taj Mahal....

title: Short Visit Only
review: We spent about 20 minutes here only, as it is poorly maintained but worth a quick look for the history of the Taj.  Some good drawings too of the Taj but when you think of the money coming into the Taj Mahal complex and its UNESCO heritage it is very poor. Miss if you are short on time.

title: Average place
review: This Museum is located within Taj Mahal boundaries and there is nothing much to see except for all items, which will hardly take 15-20 min to complete this visit.

title: Collection of Very Rare Stuff
review: The Taj museum is a small collection of interesting documents and items, mostly related to the Taj. Should probably be made more informative. Also, the panels have become old, and should probably be upgraded. It is a part of a duo of buildings that are collectively called the Jal Mahal. It is sometimes mistakenly referred to as the Naubatkhana.

title: Good Museum
review: This is one of the very good place to see at Taj Mahal. you can lot of things of olden days here and understand the culture.

title: Original Mughal 7th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal
review: 7th-century ivory portraits of Emperor Shah Jahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. excellent Taj Museum, housing a number of original Mughal miniature paintings. Taj and some nifty celadon plates, said to split into pieces or change colour if the food served on them contains poison.
